raw: SAAA 9 Peterboro Boscis mars Dan 14,1918. Hear Dr. Sleanis I whersikt was to tu should hapo you are interested kuw that tibi is the Chine New year on Feb. gite Pron Harta a. Keto Bésia is going a give a grand recepti e pludento y Boolen, in nent Cambride save one last year and eat m eer the Chinese war mirin is now in Town. I was over itu s Club Saturday for luncheon ante item and enjoyed te speeches y mue for. Koo game a ver good speech, numin aril leave this our leve this an for Hartford hera chey wiel sheet ti ammi itin ordered it Climer ovement. si embarrassed to your last letter that you shelder all the lear succeeding in you reaching a wit a mássage ape en uit me i wa heme waiting for a telephone dall after ol had told you at i có be reached tflery close I should be in one tapologine for causa you so much Cluble and I hope is not lara

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Handwritten letter in which Kwan states that he will see Mrs. Lynde on the 26th, notes that the Wellesley celebration was a success and he would like to offer a similar event at Phillips Academy, including Abbot students. The Chinese New Year celebration for Boston Chinese students will be hosted by Prof. Norton A. Kent. News about the Chinese War Mission speakers: Dr. Koo gave a good speech.
metadata.note_acquisition: Phillips Academy Archives and Special Collections received the letters and materials of Sung Sing Kwan from Alfred E. Stearns in ____(date)
metadata.note_preferred-citation: From The Trustees of Phillips Academy.
metadata.collection: Head of School (Stearns) correspondence with Chinese alumni
